alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 12:52PM EST until February 18 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 30.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EST Friday was 30.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.5 feet on 12/11/1972. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 8 PM EST Friday.
